byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Eight current and former New York City police officers are arrested and charged in federal court with accepting thousands of dollars in cash to drive a caravan of firearms into the state; arrests strike at heart of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's anti-gun initiatives and coincide with period in which NYPD has been besieged by accusations of corruption.
snippet: The officers, both current and former members of the force, are accused of corruption that defied the city’s efforts to get illegal firearms off the streets.
lead_paragraph: The officers, both current and former members of the force, are accused of corruption that defied the city’s efforts to get illegal firearms off the streets.

headline.main: 8 City Officers Charged in Gun Smuggling Case
headline.print_headline: 8 City Officers Charged in Gun Smuggling Case
headline.seo: New York Officers Accused of Smuggling Guns
